entry.title: The Dangerous Wild Animals (Northern Ireland) Order 2004

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Dangerous Wild Animals (Northern Ireland) Order 2004

entry.summary: This Order regulates the keeping of certain kinds of dangerous wild animals.

entry.title: The Air Navigation (Overseas Territories) (Amendment) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order further amends the Air Navigation (Overseas Territories) Order 2001 (referred to below as “the Order”), In addition to minor and drafting amendments the following changes are made:

entry.title: The Health Professions (Operating Department Practitioners and Miscellaneous Amendments) Order 2004

category.term: HEALTH CARE AND ASSOCIATED PROFESSIONS;HEALTH PROFESSIONS

entry.summary: This Order designates operating department practitioners as one of the professions regulated under the Health Professions Order 2001 (“the principal Order”). A number of amendments are made to the principal Order and related legislation as a consequence of this – and in addition this Order makes a number of other, miscellaneous amendments to, or relating to, the principal Order.

entry.title: The Burma (Restrictive Measures) (Overseas Territories) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order applies to each of the British overseas territories listed in Schedule 1. It imposes restrictive measures in respect of Burma and the continuing serious violations of human rights in that country and the failure of its military authorities to enter into substantive discussions with the democratic movement concerning a process leading to national reconciliation, respect for human rights and democracy. These measures include the prohibition of the delivery or supply of arms and related material and equipment that might be used for internal repression to Burma, and the prohibition of making available funds, financial assets or economic resources to listed persons and the freezing of their funds, financial assets or economic resources. It gives effect to measures adopted by the European Union in Council Common Position 2004/423/CFSP.

entry.title: The Carriage by Air Acts (Application of Provisions) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order consolidates with amendments earlier Orders made under section 10 of the Carriage by Air Act 1961 providing for the application of the Warsaw Convention 1929 as amended at the Hague 1955 and the Guadalajara Convention 1961 to carriage by air not being carriage to which the Conventions specified in the Schedules to those Acts apply.

entry.title: The Town and Country Planning (Electronic Communications) (Scotland) Order 2004
entry.summary: Section 8 of the Electronic Communications Act 2000 empowers the Scottish Ministers, with the consent of the Secretary of State (defined in section 9 of that Act) by order to modify any enactment or subordinate legislation for the purpose of authorising or facilitating the use of electronic communications. This Order modifies legislation relating to planning.

entry.title: The Energy Act 2004 (Commencement No. 1) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order brings into force, on 27th July 2004, provisions of the Energy Act 2004 specified in the Schedule to the Order.

entry.title: The A4097 Trunk Road (M42 Junction 9, Dunton Interchange to M6 Toll Slip Road, Warwickshire) Order 2004
entry.summary: This version of the The A4097 Trunk Road (M42 Junction 9, Dunton Interchange to M6 Toll Slip Road, Warwickshire) Order 2004 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: Non-Domestic Rating (Completion Notices) (Financial Adjustments) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2004
entry.summary: The Rates (Northern Ireland) Order 1977 (“the 1977 Order”) was amended with effect from 1st April 2004 to provide for the introduction of vacant rating on certain classes of unoccupied non-domestic property.

entry.title: The Care Standards Act 2000 (Extension of the Application of Part 2 to Adult Placement Schemes) (England) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations are made under the Care Standards Act 2000 (“the Act”) and apply to England only. Part 2 of the Act provides for the registration and inspection of establishments and agencies by the CSCI. Section 42 of the Act makes provision, through regulations, for the application of the Act in respect of the future registration of other services which are not covered on the face of the Act. These include services that are, or are similar to, services which local authorities provide in the exercise of their social services functions. These Regulations prescribe a person who carries on or manages an adult placement scheme for the purposes of section 42, and provide that the regulation making powers in Part 2 of the Act (regulation 2(2)) shall apply to such persons with the modifications set out in regulation 3. Regulation 2(3) specifies the CSCI as the registration authority for the purposes of sections 14(1), 16(3) and 33 to 35 of the Act.

entry.title: The Transport and Works (Inquiries Procedure) Rules 2004

ukm:Subject.Value: TRIBUNALS AND INQUIRIES, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: TRIBUNALS AND INQUIRIES, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Rules prescribe the procedure to be followed in connection with public local inquiries held under the section 11 of the Transport and Works Act 1992 (“the 1992 Act”). These relate to applications for orders under Part I of the 1992 Act authorising —

entry.title: The Beis Yaakov High School for Girls, Salford (Designation as having a Religious Character) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order designates The Beis Yaakov High School for Girls, Salford as having a religious character in accordance with section 69(3) of the School Standards and Framework Act 1998 (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Regional Assembly and Local Government Referendums (Expenses Limits for Permitted Participants) Order 2004
entry.summary: Sections 1 and 2 of the Regional Assemblies (Preparations) Act 2003 provide for the holding of referendums about the establishment of Elected Regional Assemblies and the reorganisation of local government to a single-tier in those areas that have both district and county councils.

entry.title: The Aggregates Levy (Northern Ireland Tax Credit) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision in respect of certain tax credits which are to apply in Northern Ireland during the period 1st April 2004 to 31st March 2011 as provided for by section 30A of the Finance Act 2001 (c. 9) (inserted by section 291 of the Finance Act 2004 (c. 12)).

entry.title: The Regional Assembly and Local Government Referendums (Date of Referendums, Referendum Question and Explanatory Material) (North East Region) Order 2004

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Regional Assembly and Local Government Referendums (Date of Referendums, Referendum Question and Explanatory Material) (North East Region) Order 2004

entry.summary: Part 1 of the Regional Assemblies (Preparations) Act 2003 provides for the holding of a referendum in a region about the establishment of an elected assembly for that region (“a Regional Assembly referendum”) and on the same date holding referendums in the parts of the region that have both county and district councils, about the reorganisation of those local authorities into a single tier of local government (“a local government referendum”).

entry.title: The Fur Farming (Compensation Scheme) (England) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order, which applies to England, revokes and replaces the Fur Farming (Compensation) (England) Order 2002 (S.I. 2002/221) (“the 2002 Order”).

entry.title: The Limited Liability Partnerships (2002 Act) (Commencement) Order (Northern Ireland) 2004
entry.summary: This Order brings the Limited Liability Partnerships Act (Northern Ireland) 2002 fully into operation on 13th September 2004.

entry.title: The Finance Act 2004, section 291, (Appointed Day) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order brings into force on 23rd July 2004 the provisions of primary law that provide for the new aggregates levy transitional tax credit in Northern Ireland.

entry.title: The Finance Act 2004, Section 85, (Commencement) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order provides that section 85 and Schedule 16 of the Finance Act 2004 shall come into force on 1st September 2004. The power to make this Order is contained in section 85(2) of that Act.

entry.title: The Finance Act 2004, section 19(1) and Schedule 2, (Appointed Day) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order appoints 1st August 2004 as the day on which section 19(1) of, and Schedule 2 to, the Finance Act 2004 comes into force for all purposes other than the making of any orders and regulations by virtue of that Schedule.
